result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Voting By Disqualified Person, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Roger Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Parties indicate they have reached a settlement in this case and requested that this case be put over to Friday morning.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Nicholas Cerwin, appearing for Bruce J. Landgraf, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated June 24, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roger Johnson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Roger Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Defendant Roger Johnson not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 6-16-2015. Defendant is in custody at County Jail.  Both files sent to case prep.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-16-2015 at 01:30pm
